attributes.action: Officially move Christmas Day to 25th July 2021
attributes.additional_details: In a nutshell, because we all deserve it! Everyone in the UK has, in their own small way, been a part of the fight against Covid. July Christmas in 2021 could be an extraordinary, multi-faith, symbolic and unique national event. Losing Christmas to the pandemic feels like admitting defeat. Christmas isn’t cancelled, it’s not just a poorer, disappointingly ‘different’ version ...it’s been moved. We’re going to do it again, properly, as a unifying gesture of having come through this ...in JULY!
attributes.background: Pass the appropriate & necessary legislation to allow the UK to celebrate Christmas properly on 25th July 2021. This unique, once in a generation event, would be a national celebration of all those who sacrificed so much to help the rest of us through the challenges of the Covid pandemic.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

The Government is not responsible for setting when Christmas takes place. We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign: 

Christmas in July - 2 extra days off on Friday 23rd and Monday 26th July 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/564171

Make 26th & 27th July 2021 a one off Double Bank Holiday - Christmas in July!: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/561169
